title: Best ever ranking for Women national team
body_text:
Portugal moved up one place again in relation to the last update and achieved the best position ever, benefiting from the fact that North Korea, which was in 10th place in the last update, has now left the ranking, no longer appearing in the FIFA table.
The team led by Francisco Neto, has 1752.53 points and is thus on the verge of entering the top-20, a place occupied by Switzerland, with 1772.27, while Belgium, which will be absent of the World Championship, is 19th, 1804.02
The list continues to be led by the United States, which is one of Portugal's opponents in Group E of the 2023 World Cup, which will take place in Australia and New Zealand, from July 20 to August 20, with Germany in second place and Sweden in third.
